reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This roadside motel, right off I-5 appears to be classy facility as you approach. Indeed, the service was outstanding, and the facility was clean. The problem, which was not too bad since we only stayed 2 nights, was that the room was very noisy. The walls seemed paper thin, and it seemed that all the noise from the plumbing in the motel was funneled into our room. Also, our air conditioner worked fine, but we have never heard such a loud air conditioner as it cycled on and off. We were in the lower level, perhaps another room would have made this motel more to our liking.
reviews.title: Close to Ashland, OR

reviews.text: I attended a friend's wedding at this establishment, and I found it to be very pleasant and the staff extremely accommodating. The food is delicious!
reviews.title: Great place, great service. But....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, I just cannot get over one thing. I went to the front desk to inquire about rates and packages and I just could not stop staring at one front desk agent's shirt! I don't mean to be nitpicky or anything, but someone should tell her to wash it. Mandy's shirt was so wrinkled and obviously had not been washed in weeks, you could hardly tell that it was supposed to be white and had been at one point. Honestly, it was disgusting and very distracting.
reviews.title: Basic hotel but right by airport
We'll be back next year
reviews.text: At a hotel of that stature the staff should take better pride in their appearance and uniform upkeep.
But overall I would give this hotel 5 stars!! I am definitely coming back to check out Chadwick's during one of their comedy nights in the future as well.
reviews.title: We can have our dog!

reviews.text: I spent 4 nights here while in town on business. Beds were comfortable and the room was perfect for my purpose. The microwave and kitchen area were clean and suited the needs of a business traveler tired of eating out. The wifi was anemic and a bit of a letdown, but enough to send email with no troubles.
reviews.title: Solid service

reviews.text: The Rogue Regency has a great, friendly staff. However, the building and amenities leave something to be desired. Horribly outdated rooms give an air of uncleanliness, although the rooms seem clean enough. Run down and broken chairs by the pool area and broken, and horrible equipment in the lackluster fitness room round out the "need an upgrade" trifecta. Attention to detail is non existent. The restaurant is decent.
reviews.title: Rough around the edges.

reviews.text: I spotted the Rogue Regency Inn years ago, while making the drive from San Francisco to Seattle. It was getting late and I was looking for a nice-looking hotel to spend the night. My favorite memory of this hotel is walking up to the highly polished, expensively decorated lobby -- and seeing a line of boot scrapers (stiff brushes mounted to the floor) outside the doorway!
reviews.title: Favorite "Stopover" Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant is also very good. (It's also within walking distance of an Elmer's restaurant -- a definite plus!)
reviews.title: NIce Surprise!

reviews.text: The Rogue Regency has become my standard "stopover" spot whenever driving between Seattle and San Francisco. I've had the pleasure of staying there many times.
reviews.title: Great date night escape!

reviews.text: The hotel is nice, but it needs some updating. It was clean. The pool was not heated and in another building, so it was too cold to swim. The hot tub was hot and nice. The restaurant is good, and even thought they don't provide free breakfast you get a coupon for 4.99 for breakfast. That evening their were 3 cop cars on the property looking for somebody? The next day when we were at breakfast we ask the server about it. She said that they get several prostitutes that meet up with their "Johns" in the bar and sometime get arrested. That was a bit shocking as I thought I was in a nice area and hotel? Apparently only the more "Expensive girls" hang in the bar because i's a nicer hotel? The Motel 6 is next store, and I guess isn't fancy enough for the prostitutes in Medford? The gym is very outdated.
reviews.title: Close to everything

reviews.text: When approaching the Regency, one feels as though they have arrived a resort style hotel. Large, clean rooms! Clean indoor pool! Nice restaurant with excellent food and warm, friendly staff. (order the beef dip for lunch and prime rib for dinner) Awesome sports bar with several large flat screens...comedy shows if you happen to be there on the right night... and several other amenities on site that are not available elsewhere! Interstate 5 accessible, courtesy shuttle to/from the airport. I have stayed at other hotels in the valley, however I will only stay at the Regency from now on!
reviews.title: Best ammenities and accomodations in the Rogue Valley!

reviews.text: Just not clean, and really not much else matters. I stayed here recently and just as I settled down for a much-needed rest I spied a little bug crawling in the bed. This can happen anywhere, it's true, and I give them credit for being gracious and quickly moving me to another room. However, while I didn't see anything live in the new room except myself, it just wasn't clean. There was a "goober" on my sheet (ewww) and the bathroom smelled musty. As the water came out of the faucet in the bathtub there was also a mildew smell. In summary, there are better hotels in Medford and I would view this as a last resort on any future trips there.
reviews.title: Uh-Oh!

reviews.text: We love to stop here when traveling south or north. Rooms are large, well appointed, and clean. Restaurant is very good and reasonable. The staff is friendly and helpful. Has pool. It is worth the few extra dollars. They run many specials.
reviews.title: Great place in Medford

reviews.text: easy to find right off the highway, but the staff are what really set this place ahead of the pack. everyone was very helpful and friendly, great management. you cannot find a better breakfast anywhere for a $5 bill. nice sports bar there too.
reviews.title: convenient location, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here one evening on our journey around the country. It looks nice on the outside and the staff were pleasant. The hotel could use some updating. Our room had a musty smell and the wallpaper was peeling in places. The shower had some mold spots so it definitely needs a little work. It was a decent stay despite the problems noted. It is in a good location and there are lots of restaurants in the area and central to many natural attractions.
reviews.title: Needs Some TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a gift for date night at the regency, the suite was in the basement ,dark, big and dated. The bdrm furniture was well worn and the mattress pad slipped around on the bed. I found someone else's sock under the bed. The fireplace kicked out a lot of heat., Soundproofing poor ,the upstairs neighbors moved in at 2:30 and woke me up.There was a big 2 person jacuzzi in the room and plastic champagne flutes. Robes were nice and the carpet felt clean on bare feet. The maintenance man was congenial when I called re lighting and actually unscrewed an overhead light , which was on a circuit of lights that would all be on when the reading lamps were all that was needed. Dated and drafty, nothing really suite( sweet) about it, and no Sunday newspaper.
reviews.title: Date night executive suite thumbs down

reviews.text: I have traveled to Medford several times this year and always stayed at the Rogue Regency. It is very close to the airport and the hotel runs a 24 hour shuttle which picks you up within 5 minutes of calling. The rooms are somewhat dated but comfortable enough, and include a coffee pot, refrigerator and microwave.The hotel is right across the road from a large Fred Meyer supermarket. The restaurant is quite good for dinner. I especially like that they have a wide selection of Rogue Valley wines available by the glass.The $4.99 breakfast is excellent with about 8 menu choices.
reviews.title: Friendly, Comfortable and Safe

reviews.text: Staff are always welcoming and responsive. In addition to wif-fi,there are computers and a printer in the lobby, along with lots of area information.
reviews.title: Great Service & Perks - an unexpected pleasure

reviews.text: I had business in Medford and this hotel was centrally located for my purposes.
reviews.title: Great road side hotel
